channel.title: Greens Function : Seismic Interferometry
channel.description: A Green’s function is a system’s response to an impulsive point source.1 That is, it is the influence of a point source at one given location or time, on a different location or time. Mathematically, it can be found as G in: \[ L u(x) = f(x) \] \[ u(x) = \int_\Omega G(x, y) f(y) dy \] With $u(x)$ as the response at x to source function $f(x)$ with domain $\Omega$, with y a dummy integration variable and L a linear differential operator (basically just meaning the left hand side of the first equation is some differential equation).
